articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Sources have told several papers that pressure is mounting on the prince to avoid Buckingham Palace.
articles.title: Newspaper headlines: Prince Andrew urged to avoid royal Christmas

articles.description: Ministers plan to combine smaller councils across England, prompting warnings of "turmoil" over mergers.
articles.title: Councils to be merged in major overhaul of local powers

articles.description: A local official warns the full extent of the damage is still being assessed, with entire communities devastated.
articles.title: Mayotte: Several hundred feared dead after Cyclone Chido

articles.description: The £3.6 billion takeover by Daniel Kretinsky's EP Group will be announced on Monday morning, the BBC understands.
articles.title: Royal Mail takeover by Czech billionaire approved

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: At least 37 people appear to have been butchered and likely eaten in a Bronze Age massacre in Somerset.
articles.title: Somerset Bronze Age massacre victims likely cannibalised

articles.description: Guha apologises after her remark about Indian cricketer Jasprit Bumrah caused a backlash.
articles.title: Isa Guha: Commentator sorry for calling Jasprit Bumrah 'primate'

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The BBC digs into which bits of the festive feast have gone up and down in price.
articles.title: Christmas dinner set to cost less at the supermarket this year

articles.description: Better Man tells the story of Robbie Williams' life, with him portrayed by a CGI monkey.
articles.title: Robbie Williams explains why he's a monkey in his new movie

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The San Francisco medical examiner's office determined Suchir Balaji's death to be suicide and police found no evidence of foul play.
articles.title: Suchir Balaji: OpenAI whistleblower found dead in apartment

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The BBC speaks with parents who insist the school system is "broken" as latest government estimates point to a rise in home education.
articles.title: The parents who insist home-education is the answer for their children
